title: Spending Drop, High Jobless Claims Cloud Outlook on Growth
summary: November spending fell by 0.4% as incomes dropped 1.1%. Household spending dropped for the first time in seven months and layoffs remained elevated as a surge in virus cases weighed on economic recovery.

title: Bestselling Books Week Ended December 19
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: Trump Vetoes Defense Policy Bill; Virus Aid in Limbo
summary: Two key pieces of legislation are thrown into turmoil as president objects. WASHINGTON-President Trump vetoed a $740.5 billion defense-policy bill and demanded last-minute changes to coronavirus-relief legislation, adding fresh uncertainty to the closing days of 2020 as a government shutdown loomed.

title: Trump's Defense-Bill Veto, Explained
summary: President vetoed the legislation over Confederate-named sites, troop levels and lack of changes to social-media regulation. President Trump vetoed a $740.5 billion defense-policy bill, known as the NDAA, objecting to some of its provisions related to the renaming of bases honoring Confederate figures and overseas troop levels, and that the legislation didn't end Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act.

title: U.K., EU Near Brexit Trade Deal, Officials Say
summary: Negotiators are going through the fine print of an accord, people familiar with the talks say. BRUSSELS-The U.K. and European Union are on the verge of reaching a post-Brexit trade accord, a few days before the deadline, cementing a deal that would end more than four years of uncertainty about future relations between major U.S. allies.

title: Fatal Landslide in Brazil Pushes Iron Ore Toward Record
summary: Prices of the steel ingredient near all-time high as investors bet on tightening supply at a time of strong demand. SYDNEY-Iron-ore prices are teetering near record territory as a landslide at a Brazilian iron-ore mine intensifies concerns about supply and Chinese demand runs hot.

title: Andrew Yang Exploring New York City Mayoral Run
summary: Tech entrepreneur would join crowded field of Democrats vying for city's top spot. Former Democratic presidential candidate Andrew Yang has filed paperwork with New York City's campaign finance board to explore a run for mayor.

title: 'The Oxford Handbook of Christmas' Review: The Making of a Holiday
summary: Personal gift-giving, as opposed to communal merry-making, is a recent development, but the logic of charity at Christmas is perennial.. If, on Christmas morning, you discover that Santa surprised you with a copy of "The Oxford Handbook of Christmas," what might you expect? Something like "The Boy Scout Handbook," a compendium of useful information about preserving eggnog or tying bows rather than knots? Or perhaps a religious handbook for the season that includes daily prayers and spiritual exercises?

title: In Hoc Anno Domini
summary: Resume Subscription. When Saul of Tarsus set out on his journey to Damascus the whole of the known world lay in bondage. There was one state, and it was Rome. There was one master for it all, and he was Tiberius Caesar.

title: Rocket Attack on U.S. Embassy in Iraq Largest in a Decade, General Says
summary: U.S. Central Command chief says he doesn't know if Iran directed the attack, adding, 'We do not seek a war'. WASHINGTON-The barrage of rockets launched at the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad Sunday was the largest attack on the capital's Green Zone since 2010, numbering 21 missiles, the top U.S. military commander for the Middle East said.

title: Trump vs. a GOP Senate
summary: His vetoes could cost Republicans the two Jan. 5 Georgia runoffs.. President Trump is leaving office as he entered, with a whirlwind of action that gets more attention than it accomplishes. He may also take down his party's chances of winning the Senate runoffs on Jan. 5. Does he care?

title: NBA Postpones First Game on Second Day of New Season
summary: After positive Covid tests, quarantines and James Harden's rules violation, the Rockets didn't have enough players for their Wednesday opener. The NBA made it one day before suffering the first of what could be many Covid-19 setbacks.

title: Biden Declares Political Center Alive and Well
summary: President-elect says there are enough GOP lawmakers prepared to meet him in middle that he can get things done in evenly divided Congress. President-elect Joe Biden wants you to know that reports of the death of America's political center are greatly exaggerated.

title: Science Eats Its Own
summary: A top journal retracts a study following a political outcry.. In 2020 scientific publications have leapt into the political fray. Scientific American gave its first ever Presidential endorsement to Joe Biden, declaring that Donald Trump "rejects evidence and science." The New England Journal of Medicine said in a pre-election editorial that "our current leaders have undercut trust in science."

title: Donald Trump's Sudan Progress
summary: Congress approves a deal to draw the country from its terror-supporting past.. Congress approved the Sudan Claims Resolution Act this week, and our only complaint is that it took so long. The Trump Administration produced a transformative deal with Khartoum, but extended haggling on Capitol Hill needlessly endangered the fragile Sudanese government.

title: Super Bowl Advertisers Gravitate to Humor in a Hard Time
summary: Some brands are likely to acknowledge the pandemic, but many will offer escapism. Madison Avenue is expected to rely more heavily on its funny bone in the upcoming Super Bowl, despite the upswing in Covid-19 cases and other challenges that have engulfed the country this year.

title: RPM, Chief Compliance Officer Settle SEC Claims of Accounting, Disclosure Violations
summary: The company failed to quickly make disclosures related to a Justice Department investigation. RPM International Inc. and its general counsel and chief compliance officer, Edward Moore, have agreed to pay more than $2 million to settle the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's claims they violated accounting and disclosure rules.

title: In Defense of Scrooge, Whose Thrift Blessed the World
summary: In the 1840s, Dickens didn't see how businessmen like his hero were already lifting mankind from poverty.. No Christmas story except the biblical account of Jesus' birth has been more often retold or more cherished than Charles Dickens's "A Christmas Carol," published in 1843. The reclamation of Ebenezer Scrooge has brought joy and hope to hundreds of millions of people across three centuries. "Scrooge" has become an eponym for stingy or miserly. We write in defense of this Ebenezer Scrooge, not the redeemed one.

title: 2020 Autopsies for Both Parties
summary: One lesson is that hostility motivates voters as much as enthusiasm does.. Parties often conduct autopsies after losing elections. Since Democrats and Republicans alike gained and lost so much this difficult and bizarre year, both need sober after-action reviews.

title: Breakdancing Comes to the Olympics
summary: The IOC has also approved surfing, skateboarding and sport climbing.. Surfing, skateboarding and sport climbing are now official Olympic sports. They'll debut next year at the delayed Summer Games in Tokyo and in 2024 in Paris. The International Olympic Committee announced the decision Dec. 7.

title: Covid Has Killed the Apology
summary: Johns Hopkins should create a metric for politicians who break their own coronavirus rules.. Two rare events occurred this week and no one alive is likely to see either of them again.

title: Notable & Quotable: Holidays Are for the Politicians
summary: 'She was accompanied by three generations of her family from two households.'. From a Dec. 20 Associated Press dispatch:

title: Some Hams Might Be Scarce This Holiday
summary: Supplies of boneless hams and other processed pork products could be limited as pandemic pressures meat plant operations. Supplies of holiday hams and some pork products are being stretched as Covid-19 precautions challenge meatpackers' workforces.

title: Bach and My Musical Advent Calendar
summary: A keyboard masterpiece depends on the complex relationship between sound waves and musical notes.. Mathematician Eugenia Cheng explores the uses of math beyond the classroom. Read more columns here.

title: New York City Health-Care Worker Has Severe Adverse Reaction to Covid-19 Vaccine
summary: Employee suffered anaphylaxis after getting Pfizer-BioNTech injection, but is in stable condition. Only one of the 30,000 people who have so far received the Covid-19 vaccine in New York City had a severe adverse reaction to the shot, city officials said Wednesday.

title: China's Sinovac Delays Covid-19 Vaccine Trial Results
summary: Brazil was expected to announce efficacy rate from Phase 3 trials on Wednesday. SÃO PAULO-Chinese firm Sinovac Biotech Ltd. has delayed the announcement of results from late-stage trials of its Covid-19 vaccine to January as it consolidates data from Brazil with test results from Indonesia and Turkey.

title: Treasury Yields Climb on Post-Brexit Trade Deal Hopes
summary: Yield on 10-year Treasury note at its closest in weeks to psychologically significant threshold of 1%. U.S. government-bond prices fell Wednesday as investors reacted to signs that U.K. and European Union officials were closing in on a new trade accord that would avoid tariffs being imposed at the start of next year.

title: Stocks Drift Up as Data Point to Uneven Economic Rebound
summary: Investors shrug off President Trump's request for lawmakers to amend coronavirus-aid package. The Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 edged up Wednesday, despite a string of data suggesting the economic rebound remains uneven amid the recent surge in coronavirus hospitalizations.

title: Retailers Navigate Customer Service in the Last Days of 'Shipageddon'
summary: Some companies are speeding up supply chains while others are lowering expectations before customers click 'buy'. Retailers are tweaking their supply chains and communications in a bid to alleviate customer disappointment around holiday postal delays.

title: Unhappy Festivus!
summary: Is one day enough to air all our grievances about federal spending?. Today brings an especially challenging holiday for many Americans. Much as we enjoy letting others know how they have disappointed us, this year's passing of "Seinfeld" actor Jerry Stiller makes for an especially bittersweet Festivus.

title: Past And Present (Thursday Crossword, December 24)
EPA Maintains Standard for Ozone Pollution
summary: Business groups had pushed for decision to retain current limits on pollutant. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration retained a national limit of 70 parts per billion for the pollutant ozone, the same standard set by the Obama administration, after business groups fought tougher standards.

title: Congress Punts on China Stocks
summary: A vague bill leaves accounting details to regulators and lobbyists.. The decline of Congress is a growing problem in U.S. governance, not least the degree to which it writes vague legislation that lets administrative agencies determine the actual law. An egregious example is a bill President Trump is expected to sign soon that would banish Chinese companies from U.S. stock exchanges if they don't open their external audits to federal regulators.

title: 'Shadow Lines' Review: Espionage in Reindeer Country
summary: Cold War intrigue heats up this tale of Finnish spies and KGB agents.. The recent death of John le Carré was a reminder of what a gift the Cold War was, at least to fiction. Once a seemingly inexhaustible vein of the factual and fantastical, it was a subject Le Carré himself moved away from after the Soviet Union was dissolved. But the spy series "Shadow Lines," set in mid-'50s Finland, is proof that the gift can keep on giving, especially if one examines it from an unfamiliar angle.

title: 'Farewell Amor': Dancers Without Borders
summary: In Ekwa Msangi's debut feature, a long-separated family, now reunited, must find the right steps to make a new life.. The streaming medium has become such a torrent that it's easy to overlook a small, stirring film like "Farewell Amor." A debut feature, it was written and directed by Ekwa Msangi and is available on digital platforms. "Amor" is the first word we hear in the first scene, shot in silhouette in a terminal at JFK. Actually we hear it twice, and with great warmth, from a woman, Esther (Zainab Jah), who, arriving from Africa with her school-age daughter, Sylvia (Jayme Lawson), is met by Walter (Ntare Guma Mbaho Mwine), the husband and father they haven't seen since he left for America 17 years before. So why does a movie that begins with a reunion have "farewell" in the title? Thereby hangs a delicate tale of pain and persistent hope.

title: 'Laura Ingalls Wilder: Prairie to Page' Review: The Bigger Story Behind 'Little House'
summary: This 'American Masters' documentary reveals that there's much more to the iconic author and her work than feel-good Americana.. 'Emotional comfort food" is one description used in "Laura Ingalls Wilder: Prairie to Page," about the life and work of the beloved "Little House" author and the inspiration for that enduring TV series of the 1970s and '80s, "Little House on the Prairie." Wilder's writing is often perceived as being simple, in the virtuous sense, and as American as mom and apple pie. But as this PBS documentary points out, there's nothing simple about being an American. And Wilder might actually have made it more complicated.

title: 'Sylvie's Love' Review: Lush Movie Life Reimagined
summary: Eugene Ashe's sumptuous romance in a Harlem setting rings changes on Hollywood history. Eugene Ashe's "Sylvie's Love," streaming on Amazon, takes place in the late 1950s and early 1960s, and looks like one of those lush, deliciously glossy Technicolor romances that Ross Hunter might have produced and Douglas Sirk might have directed, except for one readjustment of the formula. Most of the people in it are Black. What's startling about that is how unstartling it is until you stop to think about those old films and how narrow their spectrum was.

title: 'Meet Me in St. Louis,' 'Season for Joy' and 'An Iliad' Reviews: The Gift of Great Performances
summary: An inspired green-screen production of Hugh Wheeler's stage adaptation of Vincente Minnelli's film; a festive cabaret; and an insightful two-hand take on Homer's epic. New York's Irish Repertory Theatre has pulled off another green-screen miracle with its soul-warming webcast of a scaled-down "Meet Me in St. Louis," Hugh Wheeler's 1989 stage adaptation of Vincente Minnelli's justly beloved 1944 screen musical. Last produced by the company in 2007, this revival has been reconceived by Charlotte Moore, the show's director, for performance by a cast of 13-all taped separately in their homes-and a masked seven-piece chamber orchestra that assembled in the Irish Rep's Manhattan theater to record the score.

title: California's Misguided War on Natural Gas
summary: Unintended consequences can be a cruel mistress.. Regarding Allysia Finley's op-ed "Now We're Cooking With Gas. But Tomorrow?" (Dec. 17): Forbidding natural-gas connections in new buildings ensures that more, not less, natural gas will be consumed to meet the new demand for electricity. Similarly, government mandates for electric vehicles, space heating and cooking will increase the total amount of natural gas burned.

title: A Diaspora's Hope and a Dissident's Bravery
summary: Saying what you think can have dire consequences for Cubans.. Thank you, Mary Anastasia O'Grady, for highlighting "Cuba's San Isidro Uprising" (Americas, Dec. 21) and the constant struggle for freedom that the Cuban people having been waging for more than six decades. The courage that these young artists have is admirable and so inspiring.

title: Comparing Puritans to the Woke Is Unfair to Puritans
summary: The puritans opposed Christmas for theological reasons, but in no way opposed pleasure in general.. In "How the Woke Stole Christmas" (Free Expression, Dec. 22), Gerard Baker might as well have quoted Lord Macaulay's smear: "The Puritan hated bear-baiting, not because it gave pain to the bear, but because it gave pleasure to the spectators." Mr. Baker should know that the puritans opposed Christmas for theological reasons, but in no way opposed pleasure in general.

title: Trust the Multiplier: Spend Now to Spare Us Pain Later
summary: A well-designed $2 trillion relief package could bring the economy back to its prepandemic level by next fall.. Regarding Andy Kessler's "A Stimulus Dollar Is Only a Dollar" (Inside View, Dec. 7): You can disagree about the benefits of different fiscal responses, but there should be little disagreement that unemployed workers, renters and homeowners, hungry families, small businesses and state and local governments need a response. Ensuring families get benefits they need to put food on the table and keep a roof over their heads is argument enough for providing relief.

title: It's a Mistake to Trust Joe Biden to Investigate His Son
summary: A special counsel would greatly reduce the temptation for Mr. Biden to control the outcome of the investigation.. Your editorial ("An Unspecial Counsel for Hunter Biden," Dec. 15) overlooks an argument in favor of appointing a special counsel to investigate the business dealings of the Biden family: It isn't right to put a stumbling block before the blind-in this case, Joe Biden. Mr. Biden wouldn't be much of a father if he didn't do everything he could to help his son, even risk harming his presidency and our country. A special counsel would greatly reduce the temptation for Mr. Biden to control the outcome of the investigation, thereby reducing the risk of improper, unethical or illegal behavior.

title: What to Watch: 8 Podcasts, Movies and Shows to Stream Over Holidays
summary: Mads Mikkelsen drinks before school, Wonder Woman visits 1984 and other feasts for your eyes and ears. It's a Christmas blockbuster season like no other. With Hollywood films appearing on digital platforms at the same time (or soon after) they premiere in theaters, there's more to stream from home this year than any other holiday in history. Here's a look at where to start, whether you're watching a screen or listening to a podcast.

title: With SolarWinds Hack, Suspected Russian Hackers Again Flex Moscow's Spycraft Muscle
summary: Cyber intrusion sends a message to the West that years of sanctions haven't deterred Russia's security apparatus from conducting broad-based operations, analysts say. MOSCOW-In September, Russian President Vladimir Putin proposed a reset of U.S.-Russia relations in information security, calling for a truce to prevent incidents in cyberspace.

title: Business Travel Was Terrible-and I Miss It So Much
summary: A newfound appreciation for long waits at airports, bland rental cars and rooms without views. I keep hearing business travel may never return to pre-pandemic levels-Bill Gates suspects 50% of it will disappear-and it makes me sad. I should be grateful to have a job of any kind, and I am, but I miss those work escapes.

title: Three Reasons 2021 Could Be (a Lot) Better Than You Think
summary: Unusual nature of this recession suggests it could lead to more rapid recovery than others. Our Covid winter has begun on a grim note: Job growth is stalling, consumer spending is wilting, and a fast-spreading virus strain has raised the prospect of crippling new lockdowns.

title: Nikola, Republic Services End Garbage-Truck Collaboration
summary: Longer-than-expected development time and unexpected costs are cited. Nikola Corp. said Republic Services Inc., its partner in an effort to develop zero-emissions garbage trucks, has agreed to terminate the collaboration, marking a setback for the electric-truck startup as it tries to re-establish credibility with investors.

title: New York Law Makes Voter Registration Easier
summary: State government agencies will be required to automatically register people to vote when they do things like apply for a driver's license. New Yorkers will be automatically registered to vote when they interact with an array government agencies under a new law signed by Gov. Andrew Cuomo that supporters say will increase voter participation.

title: How British Scientists Tracked Down the New Covid-19 Variant
summary: Researchers are trying to determine whether the variant will cause more-serious disease and evade vaccines. LONDON-British public-health officials were mystified. Nationwide restrictions were driving down the spread of coronavirus across much of the country by late November. But in one part of southeast England infections were inexplicably surging.

title: Families of People With Autism, Down Syndrome Push for Vaccine Priority
summary: People with intellectual development disorders are more than twice as likely to die once infected by Covid-19, a WSJ study finds. A higher Covid-19 death rate among people with autism, Down syndrome and other intellectual development disorders has sparked a lobbying effort by family members and caregivers to persuade states to give priority to the group in vaccine rollouts.

title: Consumers Could Use Some Help This Winter
summary: Weak consumer spending data is the latest indication that the economy faces a challenging period, which could be made worse if stimulus doesn't arrive. Americans' pandemic-fueled appetite for big-ticket items may have been sated, while the rise in Covid-19 cases around the country is hurting spending elsewhere. Another round of checks from the federal government-if it comes-can only do so much.

title: Has the Fed Rewritten the Laws of Investing?
summary: Things probably aren't different this time with market valuations so high, but if they are then that still might not be so good.. The only way to argue that stocks aren't wildly expensive is to say that something fundamental has changed about the market environment.

title: Covid-19 Tests Christmas Dining in Manhattan's Chinatown
summary: Resume Subscription. For most of her life, Laurie Gwen Shapiro has visited a restaurant in Manhattan's Chinatown on Christmas Day, joining thousands of fellow local Jews in what has become a dining ritual on the holiday.

title: Kidnapped Nigerian Boys Say Ransom Was Paid for Freedom
summary: Freed captives recount mistreatment by Boko Haram, as group's terrorism and criminality appear to coalesce. KATSINA, Nigeria-It was on the third day in captivity that the Lawal brothers thought they would be executed.

title: A Massive Aspen Mansion With Its Own Bowling Alley Asks $75 Million
summary: The 20,000-square-foot home is being shopped by developer Leathem Stearn, who was accused by local officials of overbuilding on the site. A resort-style Aspen mansion with an indoor lap pool, a spa, a bowling alley, three outdoor tennis courts and a six-car garage with a turntable is coming on the market for $75 million. If it sold for close to that asking price, the home would be the most expensive ever sold in Aspen.

title: The U.S. Should Stop Underestimating Russian Power
summary: Vladimir Putin deploys capabilities and resources that have made his country a resurgent global player. In recent days, Americans have learned that Russia's equivalent to the CIA almost certainly executed the most devastating cyber-offensive in history. Over many months, the perpetrators planted malware in data systems throughout the U.S. government and Fortune 500 companies. Among the U.S. government agencies that the Russian security services appear to have infiltrated are the Departments of State, Treasury, Energy and Homeland Security, as well as the National Institutes of Health at the height of a deadly pandemic.

title: Inside a $75 Million Aspen Mansion
summary: The 20,000-square-foot home has a bowling alley, three tennis courts and an indoor lap pool. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Charter Schools vs. Eco-Tours: It's No Contest
summary: College essays by Success Academy seniors tell stories of inspiration and heartbreak.. As a trustee of Tufts University, I saw my share of college essays. More recently, as board chairman of Success Academy, a network of 47 K-12 charter schools in New York that enrolls 20,000 students, I had a bit of an awakening.

title: Who Made the Vaccine Possible? Not WHO
summary: Pharmaceutical companies and Trump's Operation Warp Speed deserve the vast bulk of the credit.. With the rollout of Covid-19 vaccines, a light has appeared in the darkness. A hard winter lies ahead, but this pandemic will soon be over.

title: Almost Silent Night: Churches Quietly Bring Music to Christmas Eve
summary: Covid safety rules mean changes to traditional caroling, including parking lot singalongs and take-home worship kits; 'Hum along behind your masks'. Hark the herald angels sing, but at the Memorial United Methodist Church this week, the congregation will be humming.

title: States Impose Strictest Covid-19 Lockdowns Since Spring
summary: Officials urge a weary, sometimes defiant, public to avoid holiday gatherings and travel. States and major cities across the country have imposed the most extensive restrictions on business and social gatherings since widespread lockdowns during the spring, in hopes of preventing a further surge in Covid-19 cases over the winter holidays.

title: 5G Auction Shatters Record as Bidding Tops $69 Billion
summary: FCC sale of wireless licenses has already hit new spending highs and the total could climb after a holiday break. The Federal Communications Commission's ongoing sale of wireless licenses has fetched more than $69.8 billion after three weeks of bidding, a record sum that could alter cellphone carriers' prospects for the next decade.

title: Columbus, Ohio, Officer Relieved of Duties After Killing Black Man
summary: Two officers were responding to a non-emergency call and neither turned on a body camera until after the shooting, according to police. A police officer in Columbus, Ohio, was relieved of his duties hours after he fatally shot a Black man Tuesday. The officer didn't turn his body camera on until after the shooting.

title: 2021 List of Home Repair Resolutions That Probably Won't Happen
summary: Wash the curtains, reupholster the furniture and fix the kitchen light-or don't!. It was easy to avoid everything wrong with your house when you lived your life largely outside it. This year, every flaw, defect and incomplete project has been throbbing like a bruise.

title: Ma's Ant Group Slashes Credit Limits for Some Younger Borrowers in China
summary: Move shows fintech giant is dialing back risk in its lending business after pressure from Chinese regulators. Ant Group Co. cut borrowing limits for some users of its popular digital credit-card service, a sign the financial-technology giant is dialing back risk in its lending business following pressure from Chinese regulators.

title: Nepal Elections Could Set Back China's Goals
summary: Division in Himalayan nation's Communist Party could allow a less pro-China party to take control. KATHMANDU, Nepal-Nepal's call for early elections could hurt China's ambitions in the country as a split in the Himalayan nation's ruling Communist Party could open the way for a less pro-China party to take control.

title: Apple's China App Store Sheds Videogames
summary: Thousands of games face removal as China's government steps up policing of content. Apple Inc. is booting thousands of videogame apps from its platform in China as the government clamps down harder on such content, illustrating the tech giant's vulnerability to state pressure on its business.

title: Pixar Brings 'Soul' and Existential Ideas to Life
summary: Filmmakers share behind-the-scenes art from the movie-making process. The film arrives on Disney+ Christmas Day.. How does Pixar distill big existential concepts into animated family movies? After exploring relationships ("Up"), emotions ("Inside Out") and mortality ("Coco"), the studio is taking a run at the metaphysical with "Soul."

title: How the U.S. Misread China's Xi: Hoping for a Globalist, It Got an Autocrat
summary: Resume Subscription. BEIJING-In the two years before Xi Jinping became China's leader in 2012, U.S. officials tried to size him up through a series of face-to-face meetings.

title: States Square Off Over Taxing Remote Workers' Income
summary: Ruling by Supreme Court would have budget implications for states that have lost billions of dollars in tax revenue during pandemic. The rise of remote workers during the Covid-19 pandemic has led to a showdown in the U.S. Supreme Court over which state gets to tax their income.

title: Lawyer Negotiated Eye-Popping Pay Deals for CEOs
summary: Joseph Bachelder, who has died at age 88, rebutted arguments that executives were overpaid. Joseph E. Bachelder III, a New York lawyer, developed a lucrative specialty in negotiating compensation for chief executive officers at major companies.

title: South Bronx Development Moves Forward After Covid-19 Pandemic Delays
summary: Universal Hip Hop Museum finds permanent home on Harlem River waterfront. A major mixed-use development on the Bronx Harlem River waterfront is scheduled to start construction next month, with developers expected to close on about $349 million in financing next week following months of delay because of the new coronavirus pandemic.

title: 2021 BMW M550i: A Sedan That Won't Put You to Sleep
summary: The German auto maker has tuned and torqued up the latest edition of its sporty four-door. Dan Neil sees what it can do on an empty stretch of highway.. AUTONOMOUS Sensory Meridian Response (ASMR) is the back door to the brain's pleasure center. It turns out that certain common stimuli-the sound of rain, the ambience of airline cabins, the murmur of audiences-have a tranquilizing, euphoric effect on humans. During the pandemic I have been binge-chilling to ASMR car-repair videos on YouTube. My new hero is Sreten (M539 Restorations), a Zen master working on insanely complex used BMWs, all by his lonesome, in a cramped storage unit in Frankfurt, Germany. "You will watch and listen to the sound of ratchets, spanners, hammers, torque wrenches and man breathing heavily at work," Sreten promises.

title: Biden's Nominees Face Narrow Path in Senate
summary: McConnell says picks would get floor votes if they get out of committee and GOP keeps majority, but some have drawn strong opposition. WASHINGTON-Some of President-elect Joe Biden's nominees are set to face a narrow path to confirmation, with potential delays that could result in his key cabinet picks being seated later than is traditional for incoming administrations.

title: Owl Rock, Dyal Agree to Merge
summary: Agreement through special-purpose acquisition company would value combined entity, Blue Owl, at $12.5 billion. Owl Rock Capital Partners LP and Dyal Capital Partners agreed to merge in a complicated deal that would take them public through a blank-check company.

title: Moderna, Supernus, Ocugen: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens
summary: U.S. stock futures were higher as investors weighed a full slate of economic data. Here's what we're watching as markets kick into gear Wednesday.

title: One Iranian Woman's Year in the Shadow of U.S. Sanctions and Covid-19
summary: Iran's troubles have fallen especially hard on members of the working class like Mahnaz Parhizkari, a single mother in Tehran. This year has been momentous for Iran, with U.S. sanctions falling hard on the economy and the coronavirus pandemic killing more than 50,000 Iranians, among the highest Covid-19 death tolls in the world.

title: Private-Debt Funds Withstand Covid-19, but Bigger Test Comes Next Year
summary: Funds that lend to smaller companies such as dentist offices and software makers have grown into a major part of the financial infrastructure. The riskiest corners of corporate-debt markets have escaped widespread damage from the Covid-19 economic crunch. Some fund managers think a reckoning may still be in store in the rapidly growing universe of private lending to smaller companies.

title: U.S. Jobless Claims Retreat From Three-Month High
summary: Claims still hovering at highest levels since recent peaks in September. The number of workers seeking unemployment benefits fell last week, amid signs the economy is continuing to recover, but at a slowing pace.

title: Gift Cards Are Go-To Holiday Gifts of 2020
summary: Shoppers are splurging on gift cards in December amid concern over store visits and shipping delays, as Covid-19 cases surge. It isn't just the PlayStation 5 and Lego Star Wars sets that are in high demand this year. Gift cards are one of the hottest holiday presents.

title: Peyton Manning Ranks His Favorite Movie Quarterbacks
summary: The Hall of Fame nominee on 'Varsity Blues' vs. 'The Longest Yard,' cutting back on beer, and the only guaranteed way to disappoint dad Archie Manning. Peyton Manning retired from football in 2016 as one of the most accomplished quarterbacks in NFL history. The future Hall-of-Famer is adding the liquor business to his post-football activities.

title: Pfizer, U.S. Reach Deal to Boost Covid-19 Vaccine Supply
summary: Company will provide 100 million more doses to bolster campaign under way in U.S.. The federal government has reached a deal with Pfizer Inc. to secure 100 million more doses of the company's Covid-19 vaccine, an agreement that will bolster the vaccination campaign under way in the U.S., Pfizer and its German partner, BioNTech SE, said Wednesday.

title: Restaurants Brace for Tough Winter After Congress Spurns Cash Grants
summary: Owners say PPP loans and tax breaks for business meals won't help much while dining rooms are closed. Many restaurant owners fear a bleak winter after their priority-cash grants to keep their businesses alive while many dining rooms are closed-wasn't included in the roughly $900 billion coronavirus relief bill approved by Congress this week.

title: Defense Deal Will Pose an Early Test for Biden Administration
summary: Lockheed's proposed acquisition of Aerojet will reveal officials' views on increasing concentration among defense contractors. The trend toward concentration in the U.S. defense industry remains unstoppable-except, potentially, by the incoming Biden administration.

title: Hong Kong High Court Grants Bail to Newspaper Publisher Jimmy Lai
summary: Surprise decision puts pro-democracy activist under effective house arrest and bars him from making public statements. HONG KONG-Jimmy Lai, the publisher of a pro-democracy newspaper in Hong Kong, was granted bail by the city's high court and placed under effective house arrest ahead of a high-profile national-security trial in April.

title: CIOs Expect Tech Investments to Climb in 2021
summary: Rapid tech deployments during the pandemic have acted as a proof-of-concept for a range of digital projects. The shaky economy would normally have corporate technology leaders facing an uphill battle to increase information-technology budgets in the year ahead.

title: With New Aircraft Carrier, France Looks to Bolster Military Ties With U.S.
summary: French President Macron plans new flagship that would be among the world's largest. U.S. allies in Europe want to show the incoming Biden administration that they have the means and the guts for serious military action. The latest example: French President Emmanuel Macron's unveiling of plans for a new nuclear-powered aircraft carrier.

title: In China, Online Grocery Shopping Gets Political
summary: The pandemic boosted the business of selling vegetables online in the country to the point where it has attracted the attention of regulators. China's internet giants have been fighting hard for grocery shoppers this year. The market has a lot of potential but, ominously, the government is getting involved.

title: Centerview Resists Lure of Record IPO Market
summary: Merger-advisory boutique plans to remain private even as peers rush to go public. As one merger-advisory boutique after another goes public, the one with as hot a hand as any is conspicuously skipping the coming-out party.

title: Etsy, Shopify Buoyed as Virus Boosts Online Sales
summary: Platforms mainly catering to small businesses are seen extending sales growth after pandemic ends. While the year has been a struggle for small businesses, some companies that host their transactions have been soaring.

title: Yogurt Maker Chobani Recruits New CFO as It Continues to Expand
summary: Jody Macedonio is set to take over as finance chief next week. Yogurt maker Chobani LLC hired a seasoned food and consumer-goods executive as its next finance chief as it expands into new food categories.

title: Agriculture Industry Bets on Carbon as a New Cash Crop
summary: Big companies and startups jockey to pay farmers for capturing greenhouse gases in fields; environmental groups question impact. U.S. farmers make their living raising crops from the soil each year. Now, some are getting paid for putting something back into their fields: carbon.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.
